Data: Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs full and slid down leg and the first one of the new ball is sent packing to the fine leg boundary
Sharma to Smith, 2 runs back of a length and on the thighs as Smith works it away to fine leg again
Sharma to Smith, no run lifter on middle and leg, Smith jumps inside the line of it and leaves.

Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs length on the pads again and it's been clipped to the square leg boundary. Easy runs these for Australia. Are India going to waste their second new ball as well. Smith raises his bat for the 63 not out as well, points to his armband as Adelaide stands up in applause
Sharma to Smith, no run fullish with a bit of curl back in on off stump, tucked to mid-on
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, left alone
Shami to Marsh, no run back of a length on off stump, defended
Shami to Marsh, no run good length ball on off stump, kept out
Shami to Marsh, FOUR runs short on middle with not enough pace behind it either. It was worth the attempt, but Marsh rocks back and pulls to the square leg boundary
Shami to Marsh, no run back of a length and outside off, left alone
Shami to Marsh, no run fuller delivery outside off, left alone by Marsh
Shami to Marsh, no run fuller delivery on off stump, pushed to mid-off
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, left alone
Sharma to Smith, no run shortish on off stump, pushed into the covers
Sharma to Smith, 1 run shortish on off stump and cramps him up, Smith manages to tuck it away through midwicket
Sharma to Marsh, no run fullish on off stump, pushed down the pitch
Sharma to Marsh, no run fullish on off stump, Marsh checks his stroke pushes to mid-off
Shami to Smith, no run fuller delivery on off stump, pushed down to mid-on
Shami to Smith, no run back of a length on off stump, defended down to mid-on
Shami to Smith, no run good length ball outside off, with a touch of movement away. Smith watches it through to the keeper
Shami to Smith, FOUR runs banged in short and it barely rises up to his stomach, Smith pounces on it with a pull that races away to the midwicket boundary

Shami to Smith, no run fuller delivery, with some appreciable cut back in. Dangerous leave from Smith and it flicks his pad as well. Mild appeal from India, almost a plea. But it would not have hit off stump
Shami to Smith, no run back of a length on off stump, defended
Aaron to Marsh, no run good length ball on middle, Marsh pushes to mid-on

Aaron to Marsh, OUT taken at gully and Kohli throws the ball high up in the air. Extra bounce gets rid of Marsh. Tight line just outside off to force the batsman to push and the variation that a new cherry provides takes care of the rest. India desperately needed that
Aaron to Lyon, no run fuller delivery on off stump, defended
Aaron to Lyon, no run bangs it in but Lyon pulls his gloves away and sways
Aaron to Lyon, no run short and wide outside off, not bothered with. Aaron's hunched over, testing his hamstring. is he cramping? He wants to continue, it would seem

Aaron to Lyon, 3 runs fuller delivery that's been met by a lovely full face of the bat from the nightwatchman. Ishant lumbers after it from mid-off, evidently tired after a very long day in the field for India's bowlers
Shami to Lyon, no run good length ball a shade outside off, Lyon judges the line well and leaves
Shami to Lyon, no run back of a length on off stump, Lyon keeps it out
Shami to Lyon, no run fuller delivery outside off, Lyon lunges forward and shoulders arms

Shami to Lyon, no run there's the outside edge, but it falls short of a diving Saha! Gets the ball to straighten off a length and because it was full enough, the batsman was drawn into a drive. Faintest of edges, but as much as Saha dived forward, he could not reach it
Shami to Lyon, no run good length ball on off stump, defended
Shami to Lyon, no run hits the back leg as he jags a back of a length delivery in off the straight. Lyon was shouldering arms, but it had struck him too high. Was in line with the stumps though
Aaron to Smith, no run good length ball a shade outside off, Smith is solidly behind it
Aaron to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, blocked
Aaron to Smith, 3 runs low full toss on off stump, tapped down the ground and the batsman jog through for a third. India showing signs of weariness
Aaron to Lyon, no run attempts a short ball, but it barely rises. And it has enough width for Lyon not to bother with
Aaron to Lyon, no run good shortish ball that. It's got good pace behind it as well and thuds into Saha's gloves as the batsman leaves outside off
Aaron to Lyon, no run fullish on off stump, Lyon is forward to block. Aaron really is not feeling well out there. Barely any followthrough
Shami to Smith, no run fullish delivery on off stump, Smith gets in line with it and adjusts for the late away movement
Shami to Smith, 1 run good length ball on leg stump, Smith nudges it through to deep midwicket.

Shami to Lyon, OUT through him! Shami has made an important break. It was a good length ball targeting middle. Lyon did not move forward enough to counter the ball moving back in and it takes an inside edge, gets the top flap of the pad and hits timber
Shami to Haddin, no run fullish on off stump and Haddin is forced to play. And so he does, a little gingerly. Hint of away movement there off the pitch
Shami to Haddin, no run good length ball on and around off stump, Haddin keeps it out

Shami to Haddin, 2 leg byes goes wide of the crease and Haddin is able to work the angle to his advantage, clipped away to deep fine leg where Aaron gets a further workout. His hamstring will not appreciate that
Karn to Smith, no run tossed up on middle and Smith is down the track immediately with a flick to short midwicket
Karn to Smith, no run looped up just outside off, Smith is forward with a defensive bat
Karn to Smith, no run skips down towards a good length ball outside off and blocks
Karn to Smith, no run fourth ball over the over, third time he uses his feet to reach out to the good length ball outside off
Karn to Smith, no run gets some bounce, but Smith has judged the line well and leaves outside off
Karn to Smith, no run flighted on off stump, defended
Shami to Haddin, no run fetches the outside edge off a good length delivery just outside off. Kohli dives to his left and keeps Haddin on strike. Gets an earnest pat on the back from Vijay

Shami to Haddin, OUT there it is, India have ended the day on a high! Haddin was struggling around the off stump and this time the edge carries through to the keeper. Beautiful delivery, and that is what the new ball can do and then placing it in the right areas - on and around off stump with some late seam away
Shami to Clarke, no run smooth drive from the Australia captain as he gets forward to a fuller ball outside off. Stopped by short cover
Shami to Clarke, no run shortish on off stump, defended and walks towards square leg. A little gingerly, actually
Shami to Clarke, no run teases him in the channel outside off and Clarke has opted for an on-the-up drive as he trusts the Adelaide pitch. Just enough movement with the new ball though beats him
Shami to Clarke, no run attempted bouncer to end the over and Clarke decides not to play at it. He wanted to though, and then jerked his torso away
Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs terrible from India's best bowler from yesterday. Lollipop short ball with miles of width and Smith has flayed it away to the point boundary
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and closer to off stump, Smith gets across to its line and blocks
Sharma to Smith, no run pushes his length fuller and a shade outside off, Smith does well not to be tempted
Sharma to Smith, no run good length ball on and around off stump, Smith matches it with a defensive blade
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and just about wide enough for Smith to decide to shoulder arms very early
Sharma to Smith, no run probes a fuller length and gets the ball to straighten as it is allowed to go through to the keeper outside the off stump

Shami to Clarke, FOUR runs width again, India began like this to David Warner yesterday and have not learned. Clarke, bad back or not, cracks it through point. Hot Spot says it pinged right off the middle
Shami to Clarke, no run shortish and a shade outside off, Clarke slices it in front of point. He seems to be quite economical with his footwork, in that he doesn't want to stretch his back too much

Shami to Clarke, 2 runs sees the short ball early, and he pulls off the front foot. It comes on him a touch too quickly and at an awkward height. Gets a top edge over mid-on and he jogs through for a couple

Shami to Clarke, 1 run full and seeking off stump, Clarke backs away and guides the ball to the right of point. Beautiful timing again, if off a manufactured stroke, and Karn Sharma helps the bowler out by keeping it to a single
Shami to Smith, 1 run banged in short and Smith has loaded up on the pull far too early. Gets an inside edge that scuttles past the keeper's left
Shami to Clarke, no run presents the open face to another widish shortish delivery and finds point
Sharma to Smith, no run gets some lift outside off, but Smith has judged it well, shuffled across to protect his off stump and lets it go

Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs finally braves a fuller ball right at off stump and gets to see some pleasing signs. Smith was sort of falling over, wand there was a touch of gap between bat and pad as he was looking to force a drive. Gets an inside edge, which skews away to the deep square leg fence. That part might have been disheartenin
Sharma to Smith, no run trademark length from Ishant as it is shortish and outside off, defended
Sharma to Smith, no run full and close enough to off stump to make Smith push forward and block
Sharma to Smith, no run fullish and a shade outside off, Smith pushes to mid-off
Sharma to Smith, FOUR runs stands up tall and punches a shortish delivery to the cover boundary. Magnificent strike, power melding with possibly the text book definition of a back foot drive

Shami to Clarke, FOUR runs stand and deliver! That's mostly because he's hampered by his back, and you know what they say about injured batsman. Barely any footwork as he sways his body away from the line of a short ball and lifts it over backward point. Amazing shot.
Shami to Clarke, 1 run was looking to back away, but Shami follows him and clips between mid-on and midwicket
Shami to Smith, 1 run tucked away off middle stump to deep square leg
Shami to Clarke, no run back of a length and on off stump, defended
Shami to Clarke, 1 run too full, too straight and Clarke would prefer those with his inability to move his feet too easily. Flicked to deep square leg

Sharma to Clarke, 1 run banged in short and he is heard groaning quite badly on the stump mic. Manages to pull it and though to deep square leg. Might warrant a short leg for him. He's in obvious pain. Took a long while to run for that single. Pain apparent on his face on the slow mos
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, not bothered with
Sharma to Smith, no run fuller delivery outside off, invites a drive and Smith obliges. Rahane at short cover does well as well
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, Smith is content to see it through to the keeper
Sharma to Smith, no run just short of a good length and outside off, Smith though has been in long enough to leave that
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length on off stump, blocked
Karn to Clarke, no run jumps down the track and hits the length ball back at the bowler
Karn to Clarke, 1 run nips down and finds a run to mid-on, even if he was labouring quite badly for it. Did come down the track to help his cause
Karn to Smith, no run pulls his length back just a bit and gets a touch of drift, enough to force Smith to be circumspect as he comes down
Karn to Smith, 1 run this one is poor though. Perhaps he was afraid of the batsman coming down and slides a shorter delivery on the pads. Smith stays deep in his crease and clips to deep square leg
Karn to Clarke, FOUR runs short again, on the pads again and Clarke has swatted it away to the deep midwicket boundary. Short-armed jab that raced away
Karn to Clarke, no run wanders down the track and clips it to silly mid-on, has to hurry back to make his ground. At least as quick as he could. Wonder if he even feels 60% out there...
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, Smith is not keen on fishing
Sharma to Smith, no run just short of a length and a shade outside off, Smith sizes up the line perfectly and leaves again
Sharma to Smith, no run the fuller length in a similar area outside off makes Smith come forward and block
Sharma to Smith, 1 run shortish and outside off, Smith pushes it past short cover for an easy single

Sharma to Clarke, 1 run goes for a short ball and Clarke swivels on his back foot and pulls. Controls it much better this time as he jogs a single to deep square leg. The grimace is still there though
Sharma to Smith, no run full on off stump, Smith drives to extra cover
Aaron to Clarke, no run good length ball a shade outside off, defended
Aaron to Clarke, 1 run too full and his angle pushes the ball down leg, Clarke flicks calmly to deep square leg
Aaron to Smith, no run 144kph, was it the extra pace that made the misstep? Smith goes for a flick to a full, leg-side delivery and gets a leading edge to point
Aaron to Smith, no run fuller delivery on off stump, Smith defends from the crease
Aaron to Smith, no run sublime stroke, and yet he seemed to be walking into the cover drive on the up. As exquisite as the timing was, he fails to pick the gap
Aaron to Smith, no run very brave leave from Smith as the good length ball darts back in and almost kisses off stump
Sharma to Clarke, no run the length is just not quite full enough, Clarke has read it early, realises this poses no threat to his stumps and leaves
Sharma to Clarke, no run back of a length and angled in at the batsman, Clarke trusts the bounce and leaves it almost over off stump. Only almost though
Sharma to Clarke, no run brings Clarke forward and makes him play because this was more middle and off. Inside edged to mid-on
Sharma to Clarke, no run good length ball on middle, Clarke blocks
Sharma to Clarke, no run shortish and a shade outside off, Clarke was looking to thread it through the off side and gets it off the inside edge
Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs too full, too far down leg and Aaron has been clipped away to the fine leg boundary. What a gift
Aaron to Smith, no run short and outside off, punched to cover
Aaron to Smith, no run full on off stump, but that strong bottom handed grip comes into play as he flicks wide of mid-on
Aaron to Smith, 1 run shortish and outside off, Smith drills it to the left of cover
Aaron to Clarke, no run not as much width, but with Clarke happy to stay leg side of the ball and the length being short as well, he is able to cut to point

Aaron to Clarke, FOUR runs how well has he done that! Swayed away from the short delivery as if he were prepped to leave it and then uses his wrists to plant an open face on the ball and lift it to the backward point boundary
Shami to Smith, no run back of a length and outside off, defended
Shami to Smith, no run fullish and slanting into the pads, Smith works it to midwicket. One ball on off, the next on leg... and Kohli comes up to have a word
Shami to Smith, 1 run fuller ball on off stump, Smith works it to the right of mid-on
Shami to Clarke, no run good length ball outside off, Clarke looks to cut and gets an inside edge that deflects rather dangerously close to off stump
Shami to Clarke, no run short and wide and barely any pace on it, Shami is lucky that Clarke has picked out point
Shami to Clarke, no run good length ball outside off, Clarke bunts it to mid-on
Aaron to Smith, no run gives Smith ample time to rock on the back foot, line up the short delivery and punch to point
Aaron to Smith, no run fullish on off stump, Smith defends

Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs eased through extra cover and Smith is racing towards his ton. Friendly half-volley on off stump which has been duly dispatched with a lovely, straight face. His driving has improved tremendously since he started playing, especially through the off side
Aaron to Smith, no run reverts back to a shortish length and Smith blocks to cover. And now the rain is coming down quite hard

Aaron to Smith, 2 runs ton-up for Steven Smith as he tucks a simple delivery off his pads and clips it to deep square leg. Jogs away towards the '408' that's painted on the turf and raises his bat in tribute to Phillip Hughes. Big hug from Clarke, emotional scenes are Adelaide again as the crowd rises up in applause
Aaron to Smith, no run short and wide, Smith strokes it into the covers
Karn to Clarke, 1 run skips down the track and Clarke drives to mid-off to bring up the 408th run of Australia's innings. Fitting that Clarke scored it, wasn't it? Standing ovation around Adelaide
Karn to Smith, 1 run gets down the track, takes the flighted ball on the full and drills to long-on
Karn to Clarke, FOUR runs beautiful footwork from Clarke as he advances at Karn and lofts him over his head. Goes past 2000 Test runs against India with a stroke that rather defines him

Karn to Clarke, 3 runs well bowled, Karn! He's brave enough to toss the ball up and Clarke came down the pitch again. Couldn't reach it and the turn fetches his outside edge past the lone slip fielder
Karn to Smith, 1 run short and wide as well, Smith chops it through point

Karn to Clarke, FOUR runs too easy for Clarke. He'd made this ball happen by the threat he poses with his ability to dance down the pitch. Karn bowls short, the legspin offers enough room and Clarke waits just long enough to beat point in the deep
Vijay to Smith, 1 run nips down the track and Smith works it away to deep square leg. He's been doing that against the specialist spinner, why should he change against the part-timer?
Vijay to Clarke, 1 run works away past the diving midwicket fielder as he tries to reach the pitch of the ball
Vijay to Smith, no run tossed up outside off, Smith bunts it back at the bowler
Vijay to Smith, no run advances down to nudges a fuller delivery to short midwicket
Vijay to Smith, no run elegant stroke into the covers as Vijay tosses it up outside off
Vijay to Smith, no run good length ball which draws Smith forward and block with a slightly open face. The outside edge falls short of slip though
Aaron to Clarke, no run it's the bouncer first up at 139 kph, Clarke is forced to duck under it as it sails over middle and leg
Aaron to Clarke, no run top class bouncer again, this at 138 kph, and Clarke has done quite well too. Dropped his wrists and swayed his head away as the ball skirted past his ear
Aaron to Clarke, 1 run didn't quite rise up as much as Aaron would have liked and Clarke is able to pull to deep square leg. Actually it was more of a glide considering he barely hit the ball
Aaron to Smith, 1 run width offered and Smith has sliced it away to deep point. Not the ideal line against any batsman, least of all one batting past a century

Aaron to Clarke, 1 run clipped away off his thighs and picks up his 28th hundred in Tests. Clarke lifts his helmet and kisses the Australia crest. Warm appreciation from the Adelaide crowd. His average is skyrocketing here
Karn to Clarke, 1 run turns a flighted delivery into a full toss as he advances down and clips Karn, the new bowler, to long-on
Karn to Smith, 1 run leaves the crease and pushes a flighted delivery on the pads to long-on as well
Karn to Clarke, no run eases a flighted delivery to the man at cover
Karn to Clarke, 1 run turned away past midwicket as Karn flights the ball well enough, but doesn't take care of his line
Karn to Smith, FOUR runs poor ball and Smith dispatches a short and wide delivery away to the point boundary.
Karn to Smith, no run flighted on off stump, defended as he strode down the pitch
Aaron to Clarke, no run fuller delivery that is slanted across the right-hander, Clarke backs away to slap it through the off side and is beaten
Aaron to Clarke, 1 run good bouncer, got it to lift above Clarke's left shoulder and yet the batsman was able to pull it down to deep square leg

Aaron to Smith, 2 runs drills a full delivery from off stump to deep cover. Cleared that front leg and hammered it away, looks like Australia are prepping for a declaration. And Ishant's cap had fallen on the ball while he was gathering that ball up. Technically, that should be penalties, right?
Aaron to Smith, no run bouncer from over the wicket to Smith, who sways away and tries an upper cut. Can't reach it
Aaron to Smith, no run shortish on middle and leg, Smith taps it towards short midwicket

Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs belted back down the ground and Aaron was in terrible trouble there! Reflex made him go for a catch as Smith cleared the front leg and unleashed every bit of power he had into the strike. Deflects off the bowler to the boundary. Smith raises a hand in apology immediately. That could have been quite scary!
Karn to Clarke, no run gets down the pitch, but Karn draws the ball away outside off and the length is shorter as well so Clarke has to block
Karn to Clarke, no run
Karn to Clarke, no run flighted delivery outside off, driven to mid-off
Karn to Clarke, no run good length ball brings Clarke forward to block
Karn to Clarke, 1 run
Karn to Smith, 1 run slower through the air on middle and off, Smith goes back and works it to deep square leg

Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs swat! Smith was almost forward and carves a bouncer down to the long-on boundary. Umpire says one for the over as the batsman forehands it with sheer power being the only concern

Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs goes fuller and Smith has clocked it away to the midwicket boundary. Australia want to stick India's openers back in with the light fading in the evening. Imaging facing Mitch like that?
Aaron to Smith, no run shortish and outside off, Smith was pulling away to the leg side as well and tries an upper cut. Fails to connect and punches his bat in disappointment
Aaron to Smith, 2 runs bouncer on leg stump, but Smith is seeing the ball well enough to have loads of time to pull to fine leg. Shami was the man who pulls out a timely boot

Aaron to Smith, FOUR runs the umpire better watch out. Aaron might be asking his captain to take him off judging by the danger of these flat-batted missiles Smith is directing down the ground. How does a short ball end up there?
Aaron to Smith, 1 run full toss on leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg. This is overdrive and how!

Karn to Smith, no run missed stumping by Saha. Beautiful flight from Karn even as the batsman was dancing down the track and with Smith in this mood, wanting to slog everything, he plays against the turn and survives as Saha barely tracked the ball.
Karn to Smith, 1 run flighted outside off, eased down the ground with a beautifully straight bat
Karn to Clarke, no run
Karn to Clarke, 1 run nips down the track and drives to long-off
Karn to Smith, no run shortish and outside off, chopped towards point
Karn to Smith, 1 run stays back, rises with the bounce and punches the ball to deep cover
Shami to Smith, no run a touch slower at 131kph, Smith was set up for a crack through cover but had to adjust and find cover
Shami to Smith, FOUR runs shortish and outside off, steered past the diving gully fielder. Dhawan was the culprit who gives away a boundary

Shami to Smith, FOUR runs he is in supreme form! This was a full delivery seeking the base of middle stump, and Smith has given the bowler a full view of it. As if to tease him, and then unveils a stunning cover drive. Hits the gap and roars to the fence
Shami to Smith, no run wide of the crease and the short ball on off stump has been slid to gully
Shami to Smith, 1 run gets across on off stump and tucks a fuller ball through to deep midwicket
Shami to Clarke, FOUR runs short and wide, Clarke was backing away to try and cut and has to eventually reach out. Gets a thick edge through slip and gully. And with that shot another shower arrives
Karn to Smith, no run tossed up on leg stump, opts for a sweep but can't quite connect
Karn to Smith, 1 run shortish and on the pads, nudged away through midwicket
Karn to Clarke, 1 run goes back and across and clips a flatter delivery from off stump to deep midwicket
Karn to Smith, 1 run loopy delivery on middle, Smith has nailed the sweep this time. Brought the bat down on top of the ball and middled it to deep square leg
Karn to Clarke, 1 run tossed up outside off and Clarke has eased it to the sweeper on the off side
Karn to Smith, 1 run swept behind square by Smith as this is flighted on the pads
Shami to Smith, 2 runs worked away off his knees and deep fine leg has to run a long way to his left to catch up with it
Shami to Smith, 1 run it's been quite profitable for him and he continues weaving that front leg aside and slices a short ball outside off to deep point
Shami to Clarke, no run banged in short, perhaps a bit too much so which allows Clarke ample time to get under it
Shami to Clarke, no run goes around to Clarke and delivers a short ball on middle. Clarke blocks it by his feet
Shami to Clarke, 1 run persists with the short-pitched line of attack and pulls to deep midwicket
Shami to Smith, no run well bowled. He's trumped Smith's efforts to open up the off side and cart him away. Finds the blockhole and keeps Smith to a defensive push to mid-off
Karn to Clarke, 1 run comes down the track to slog over cow corner, odd stroke for Clarke to be playing, but the situation demands it. Inside edge skews to fine leg
Karn to Smith, no run flighted and drifting on middle and off, Smith looks to hack it to fine leg as he brings down a straight bat on top of the ball and shovel it behind him
Karn to Smith, no run flighted on leg, Smith sweeps powerfully finds square leg
Karn to Smith, no run tossed up on leg stump and Smith was trying to make room to open up the off side. Finds a yorker on leg and has to dig it out. Very awkwardly. Barely managed to stay standing
Karn to Smith, no run good length ball on leg stump and turning away, Smith's sweep is of no use this time
Karn to Smith, no run reverse this time and it tickles off the glove and could easily have knocked over the off stump
Shami to Clarke, 1 run back of a length and outside off, opens the face to run it to deep point
Shami to Smith, 1 run short and wide, slapped to the man square on the off side boundary
Shami to Clarke, no run back of a good length on off stump, and Shami's bowling around to Clarke, defended

Shami to Clarke, 1 run goes for a short ball on middle and Clarke isn't as fluent as his normal self. He's still tucked up despite moving across outside off and just about deflects it down to fine leg
Shami to Smith, 1 run short and a shade outside off, Smith pulls it behind square leg and brings up his maiden 150 in Tests
Shami to Clarke, no run full and on the pads, Clarke though prefers to go back and clip to short midwikcet
Karn to Smith, no run flighted on leg stump and spinning further away, which makes the sweep a difficult stroke. Misses it

Karn to Smith, 3 runs moves away outside leg to try and carve the flighted ball from well outside leg over the covers. Gets a thick outside edge that flies to Kohli's left at slip. Too tough a catch to pull off and Clarke pushes himself to get three
Karn to Clarke, 2 runs lap swept towards fine leg for a single
Karn to Clarke, 1 run goes back and clips a shortish delivery through square leg
Karn to Smith, no run slower through the air and flighted on the rough, goes for a sweep but can't pull it off from this angle
Karn to Smith, 1 run good length ball on off stump, steered behind point

Sharma to Smith, 1 run one bounce to deep midwicket! It was length, it was the kind of ball that early on in a Test might have been blocked but Smith and Australia are chasing a declaration so it has to be slogged away
Sharma to Clarke, no run good short ball from Ishant, rises over Clarke's left shoulder and goes on to the keeper

Sharma to Clarke, no run mid-on and midwicket chase after a leading edge, Rahane from mid-on dives and tries his hardest to get his hands under it. But just as it had lobbed over Pujara, it drops short of Rahane
Sharma to Clarke, no run short and slid down leg, Clarke does not bother
Sharma to Clarke, 1 run moves outside leg and negotiates a shortish ball off his hips to deep square leg

Sharma to Smith, 5 wide saw the batsman backing away down leg, Ishant went further past him and the keeper cannot save him the blushes. Five wides raise the 500 of the Australians as ishant looks at his hand in disbelief
Sharma to Smith, no run back of a length on off stump, defended
Karn to Clarke, FOUR runs how clean was that. Perfect example of how fast his feet are and then once he was to the pitch of the ball, straight batted it through mdiwicket!
Karn to Clarke, 1 run tossed up outside off, driven to long-off
Karn to Smith, 2 runs if the orthodox sweep doesn't work, try the reverse. Drags a fuller delivery from way outside leg to deep third man
Karn to Smith, 1 run flighted into the rough and Smith is still able to clobber it to deep fine leg with the sweep
Karn to Clarke, no run short on leg stump, nudged to square leg
Karn to Clarke, no run a touch more bounce and it doesn't really turn as much. Clarke is uncertain about it and blocks with soft hands. Gets an inside edge through his legs
Sharma to Smith, no run tries to swing off his feet against a length ball on off stump and inside edges it onto his thigh pad
Sharma to Smith, 2 runs does away with the front leg and creams a length delivery to deep midwicket. He's stopped looking pretty now, but his threat is still very sound
Sharma to Smith, no run good length ball slanted at Clarke even as he was backing away. Can't connect with the flick
Sharma to Smith, 1 run banged in short and Smith has pulled it to deep square leg
Sharma to Clarke, FOUR runs front-foot pull from Clarke beats midwicket and then rushes away to the boundary after that. Chin scratching time, and has been for quite a bit for Kohli
Sharma to Clarke, no run back of a length on off stump, defended

Karn to Smith, 1 run Ishant has dropped it. Not that this ball deserved a wicket as Karn bowls length on leg stump and is swept quite powerfully. Deep fine leg has misjudged it though and stayed back when he should have come forward. Ball drops short of his dive

Karn to Clarke, OUT no mistake this time. Clarke goes for a sweep and has found square leg. Adelaide stands up to appreciate their captain. The coach pats him on the head as he walks back, his family is there as well. Looks quite weary as he walks off.
Karn to Johnson, no run good length ball a shade outside off, defended
Karn to Johnson, no run flighted on middle and Johnson comes forward to block
Karn to Johnson, no run moves around the wicket and targets the rough with a good length ball and keeps Johnson to a defensive push
Karn to Johnson, no run a shade short which prompts Johnson to go back and cut. Too much spin for him to pull the shot off

Steven Smith has continued making a name for himself in Test cricket, and at times batted like he was two different people. A polished strokemaker for much of the innings and then a slog-overs specialist in the latter half. Michael Clarke strode out at the start of the day, back injury and all, and his sudden appearance seemed to have wilted

It's been 30.4 overs, Australia have hammered 163 runs and India's bowlers did not look like they could change the tide. As is usual for Adelaide which has the highest average for first and second innings scores since 2000. For further analysis, do tune in to Match Point with Stuart MacGill and Ajit Agarkar.

5.55 pm The umpires have decided to call stumps. The light seems to have deteriorated too much for play to continue it would seem. We will look to compensate for the play that's been lost today with an early start tomorrow and possibly for the remaining days of the Test as well. So do join us tomorrow at 10.00 am when play will begin.
Siddle to Rahane, FOUR runs driven smartly through the covers and his timing is stunning. Took the good length ball on the up and plays through the line
Siddle to Rahane, no run presses forward to a length ball outside off and blocks
Siddle to Rahane, 1 run a bit too straight and Rahane gets outside the line and clips the ball behind square leg
Siddle to Kohli, no run back of a good length and outside off, Kohli plants his front leg across and leaves
Siddle to Kohli, 1 run fullish on off stump, Kohli is able to work the ball away with the angle to deep fine leg
Siddle to Rahane, 1 run goes for the short ball and Rahane is happy to pull and keep it down to fine leg
Harris to Rahane, no run fullish on and around off stump, Rahane is forward with a defensive bat
Harris to Rahane, FOUR runs looks to hit a yorker on off stump, Rahane tried to jam his bat down. Gets a bit of a bottom edge, bounces and then leapfrogs the keeper! Bizarre!
Harris to Rahane, no run fullish on off stump, Rahane uses his wrists and turns it to square leg to bring up the fifty partnership. Third of the innings, I guess
Harris to Rahane, 2 runs invites the drive through the off side and Rahane's timing is alive and kicking. Johnson goes for a slide and parries the ball away to gift a couple
Harris to Rahane, FOUR runs short and wide, Rahane was waiting for it. Camped on the back foot and crashed through point. Lyon was the man diving to his right, slaps the turf in frustration
Harris to Rahane, no run lands the yorker on off stump and it's dug out
Siddle to Kohli, 1 run shortish and outside off, pulled and kept down to deep square leg. He was on the front foot as well. Looks like Kohli's not troubled by the pace anymore

Siddle to Rahane, FOUR runs in the air and Lyon charges in from the square leg boundary and throws himself forward in hopes of catching the top edge, but it drops short of him and runs away to the boundary
Siddle to Rahane, no run third short ball on the trot, but its been slid down leg and Rahane shoulders arms
Siddle to Rahane, 1 run banged in and outside off, Rahane pulls off the front foot to deep square leg
Siddle to Kohli, 1 run good bouncer on middle and Kohli is in some discomfort as he tries to pull. Ends up fending it away behind square leg
Siddle to Rahane, no run pulled to the man who seems to be at a leg gully position for the short-pitched bowling
Lyon to Kohli, no run flighted on off stump and Kohli is forward to smother it
Lyon to Kohli, no run goes back to a good lengt hball and taps it to short leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run flat and snaking down leg, Kohli looks to pull it away but it isn't as short as he expected. Finds short fine leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run good length ball skidding in off the pitch. Kohli plants an open face down on it and guides it past slip
Lyon to Kohli, no run stays back and clips a good length ball towards short leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run tapped to short leg again as he goes back to a flatter delivery outside off
Siddle to Rahane, 1 run shortish and outside off, Rahane guides the ball off the back foot to deep square leg
Siddle to Kohli, no run keeps digging it short and Kohli swivels on the back foot to pull to square leg
Siddle to Kohli, 1 run stands up tall behind a shortish delivery outside off and punched down to mid-on
Siddle to Rahane, 1 wide banged in way too short and Rahane barely even had to duck. Umpire Erasmus says that was too high
Siddle to Rahane, FOUR runs what a lovely punch! It was a 118 kph delivery which was short and wide as well. Rahane stood up tall behind it and powered it away with his bottom hand.
Siddle to Rahane, no run dug in short and outside off, Rahane sways away

Siddle to Rahane, no run gets up with a short ball and taps it past gully and searches for the single that would bring him another Test fifty, but Kohli is not too keen. Think there was a single there, really
Lyon to Kohli, no run lovely bowling. He tosses the ball up into the rough outside off and draws Kohli into pushing with his hands outside off
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run flighted on off stump, nudged to mid-on
Lyon to Rahane, 1 run goes back and rides the bounce on a shortish delivery through point and gets the single he needs for his fifty. And it's been an eventful one
Lyon to Kohli, no run flighted outside off and Kohli was set up to lash it down the ground. Lyon's outstretched hand intervenes though
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run flighted outside off and Kohli leans forward to work the ball with the turn to wide mid-on. All the batsmen have run between the wickets strikingly well
Lyon to Rahane, 2 runs shot! Good stride forward to get to the pitch of the ball and caressed the ball past mid-off's right. He looks very pleasing when he's relies on his timing
Smith to Kohli, FOUR runs long hop to start off with and Kohli has slapped it to the left of mid-on. Smith would know that stroke quite well, the flat-batted thump
Smith to Kohli, no run full toss second ball and Kohli has driven it straight at short cover
Smith to Kohli, 1 run flighted on off stump and Kohli stays leg side of the ball to drive inside out through the covers
Smith to Rahane, no run he's hit his length now. Beautiful flight on the ball as it drops on middle and Rahane comes forward to block

Smith to Rahane, 3 runs short and wide now, so Rahane has backed away and slapped it through extra cover. Chris Rogers has a lot of distance to cover to his left, pulls out a desperate dive and seems to have flicked the ball back. Has he? Yep! Top work
Smith to Kohli, 1 run tossed up on leg stump, Kohli works it to deep midwicket
Lyon to Kohli, no run gets down the track to a flighted ball on off stump and blocks
Lyon to Kohli, no run goes back to a length ball and works it past short leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run almost gets too close to the ball with his shimmy and drills it back at Lyon
Lyon to Kohli, no run a bit short and Kohli has swatted it away, but hits short leg. Warner is the man under the lid
Lyon to Kohli, FOUR runs whipped down the ground. The dominant bottom hand comes into play for Kohli as he lines up a flighted ball and thumps it past mid-on
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run goes back to a length ball on off stump and blocks.
Smith to Kohli, no run tossed up on middle and Kohli keeps it out
Smith to Kohli, 1 run looped up on leg stump, Kohli taps it towards mid-on
Smith to Rahane, 1 run beautiful flight from Smith and he corrects his line. This is on off stump, and Rahane is able to drive inside out through the covers
Smith to Kohli, 1 run worked away through midwicket
Smith to Rahane, 1 run shortish and outside off, punched into the covers
Smith to Kohli, 1 run short and wide, without much turn. Kohli chops it away to the sweeper
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run stays back to a flatter ball on leg stump and worked away to deep square leg
Lyon to Rahane, no run flighted on off stump, Rahane is forward to block
Lyon to Rahane, no run presses forward and keeps bat and pad together, and his hands are low as well to defend the flighted ball outside off
Lyon to Rahane, no run turn from outside off, but Rahane has jumped back and accounted for it with a punch into the covers
Lyon to Rahane, 1 run flighted on middle and Rahane rolls his wrists on top of the ball and pushes to mid-on
Lyon to Kohli, no run length and outside off, Kohli goes back and clips to short leg
Smith to Rahane, 2 runs flighted on the pads, not where he'd want to land it as Rahane clips towards fine leg
Smith to Rahane, no run length ball angled in on middle and turning away. Rahane blocks well
Smith to Rahane, 1 run loads of flight and it dips to become a yorker, Rahane works it away through midwicket
Smith to Kohli, 1 run flighted and angled in on the pads, Kohli works it wide of mid-on
Smith to Rahane, 1 run a bit short and a bit wide, Rahane backs away and cuts to the sweeper
Smith to Kohli, no run goes back to a fullish delivery but is able to punch to the ball to short leg
Lyon to Rahane, no run appeal for a catch at short leg, but there wasn't any bat involved. Acrobatic effort from Warner there as he leaps high to his left and clings on

Lyon to Rahane, OUT unplayable! That leaped up off a good length and Rahane, having gone back to block, is thoroughly stunned. he does not know where the ball went after taking his glove. and finally realises he is caught by slip running to his left. What a time to strike, the new ball is right around the corner
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run flighted outside off and Rohit is forward with a block
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run flighted outside off and blocked into the off side
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run presses forward to block a flighted delivery outside off
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run swept, one of the few we have seen from the Indians today as Rohit takes a flighted ball on off stump and sends it to deep square leg
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length and outside off, Rohit pokes with an open face and gets an outside edge to first slip. Soft hands though keeps the ball down
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball outside off, comes forward to block
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run full on leg stump, Rohit has casually clipped it to square leg
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run leans into a push to mid-off as Watson bowls full and outside off
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball a shade outside off, Rohit guides it to gully
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length on off stump, Rohit taps to short midwicket
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run flighted outside off, swatted away to long-on
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 3 runs rare full toss from Lyon and Rohit has pushes it through extra cover and collects three runs. Good work between the wickets
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run worked through square leg to the man in the deep
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run nips forward to a flighted ball outside off, defended
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run tossed up on off stump, Rohit closes his face a bit too early and gets an outside edge. But he was playing with soft hands
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run flatter and quicker on middle, Rohit is back to block
Watson to Kohli, no run that's the second time he's broken the stumps at the non-strikers'. Lovely timing again as he leaned forward to a fuller ball and presented a gorgeous straight face
Watson to Kohli, no run full and straight, flicked away to midwicket
Watson to Kohli, no run fullish on off stump, Kohli has tapped it back at the bowler again. That's what you have to do on a pitch like this, play with a straight bat

Watson to Kohli, no run opens the face against a shortish ball outside off and runs it down towards point. Uncertainty between the two new partners, who are often prone to run-outs, means they take the safer route and decide against the single
Watson to Kohli, 1 run too full and curling in, Kohli waits on it and clips to deep fine leg to bring up India's three-hundred
Watson to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length and seaming back in, Rohit blocks from the crease with visible gap between bat and pad. Inside edges it
Lyon to Kohli, no run flighted outside off to draw Kohli forward, gets the inside edge but his low hands keeps the ball down
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run goes back and clips a flatter ball past short leg

Lyon to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs swept from well outside off and he's found the gap between fine leg and square leg. He does time the ball quite well, so I guess that's what happened because he barely hit it
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run tossed up outside off and brings Rohit to drive with an angled face for a single in front of point
Lyon to Kohli, no run flighted outside off, Kohli pushes forward to block into the covers
Lyon to Kohli, no run tucked away to short midwicket and that might be drinks, I think
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run swing straight away, and though it's quite full Harris has slanted it a bit too far across to interest Rohit
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run left well alone again as Harris gets the ball to move away from outside off
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fuller delivery a shade outside off and Rohit gets an outside edge which drops short of the cordon
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run strays on the pads and Rohit clips him to square leg. Looks intent not to push with hard hands, does Rohit. But he's not yet been tested in the off stump channel
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fuller delivery on off stump, drives at mid-off

Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run there it is, that's why Australia took the new ball and gave it to Harris. Hits a good length just outside off to lure Rohit into a front foot block and then jags the ball away past the outside edge

Johnson to Kohli, FOUR runs how lovely must that feel. First ball he faces off the new cherry and he sends it packing to the cover boundary. Johnson bowls fuller and across the right-hander and it is met with a solid front-foot drill
Johnson to Kohli, no run shortish on the body and Kohli works it away off his hips to square leg
Johnson to Kohli, 2 runs width on offer and Kohli has slapped it through the covers. Not quite enough room for him to play that shot, which is why he mistimes it

Johnson to Kohli, FOUR runs this time off the back foot and that's the second boundary off the over. Kohli did say India would handle Johnson and he is leading the way. Back of a length delivery has been punched off the middle of the bat through the covers. Lack of sideways movement from Johnson means Kohli can hit through the line wi
Johnson to Kohli, no run good length ball which is tighter on off stump, defended
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run on the pads and Kohli is able to work it behind square leg and retain strike
Harris to Kohli, no run back of a length on off stump, Kohli desperately wants to counterattack against the new ball. Goes for a flick and gets a bit of an edge into the off side
Harris to Kohli, no run full on off stump, Kohli closes the face again and the ball skews away into the covers. Straighter bat needed
Harris to Kohli, 1 run good length ball on middle, Kohli flicks it to deep fine leg
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run full on off stump, Rohit drives off the bottom of the bat to mid-off
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run banged in short and Rohit has lots of time to duck under it
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish on off stump, Rohit carefully pushes to mid-on
Johnson to Kohli, FOUR runs smashed to the midwicket boundary, off the front foot! How is that against a 142 kph short ball. Although apart from the pace, it had nothing. Sat up to be slammed
Johnson to Kohli, no run shortish and slid across the right-hander who guides it to gully
Johnson to Kohli, 2 runs shortish on the hips of Kohli and he nudges it to deep fine leg, sees Harris down there and immediately realises there is two on offer
Johnson to Kohli, no run bouncer at 135 kph, Kohli was set up for the pull like Clarke often is and then decides not to go through with the threat
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run 142kph, another short ball, this one better directed and the pace is up as well. Kohli has to leap off the turf and tuck it through square leg
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs leans into a checked drive and his gift of timing allows him to collect a couple of runs through the covers. Too full and wide from Johnson
Marsh to Kohli, no run good length ball in the off stump channel, defended
Marsh to Kohli, 2 runs worked away past mid-on and the placement is fine enough to take a couple of runs
Marsh to Kohli, 1 run shortish on off stump, worked to the right of mid-on and races across to the other end again
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, no run shortish on off stump, worked to midwicket
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, no run oopsy, there's the lazy drive on the up and Marsh is able to jag the ball away off a good length to beat him. Rohit was walking into the shot as well.
Harris to Kohli, no run back of a length and outside off, left well alone
Harris to Kohli, no run short of a length and outside off, kept out
Harris to Kohli, 1 leg bye full and slanted at the pads, and hits it with Kohli looking to flick. Secures a single before square leg can catch up with it
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball a shade outside off, Rohit plays late and steers it to point
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run stands up behind a shortish ball outside off and pushes to cover

Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish on middle, Rohit plays the angle as he looks towards midwicket and gets a leading edge. But he ensures his hands held the bat softly and the ball bounces before reaching the bowler
Marsh to Kohli, 3 runs quality stroke from Kohli again as he brings down a straight face on a fuller ball and sees it race away past the bowler. All he wants to do is time the ball
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, no run shortish and outside off, Rohit punches it to cover
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs curls in late, but it's a half volley. Rohit pounces on it with a flick that screams away to the square leg boundary
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball outside off, not bothered with
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs length ball lambasted over midwicket. How easily did he do that, picked up the gimme ball early and has collected a boundary that was offered to him on a platter
Marsh to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish on leg stump, Rohit looks to close the face and gets a little outside edge
Lyon to Kohli, no run starts off with a flatter ball on off stump which Kohli works to square leg
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run strays down leg this time and Kohli is quick to go back and whip the ball past short fine leg
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run tossed up on middle, Rohit nudges it towards short leg
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run he manages to get appreciable turn off the new ball as well, Rohit waits for it and clips it to fine leg
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run gets down the track and taps a flighted ball down to mid-on
Lyon to Kohli, no run tries to whip a loopy ball from off stump to square leg, but short leg is in the middle
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish on off stump, defended
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, 1 run back of a length and outside off, Rohit pushes to the left of cover and sets off
Siddle to Kohli, 3 runs full on off stump, Kohli waits on it and then rolls his wrists at the perfect moment to send the ball racing past Michael Clarke at mid-on
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run shortish and outside off, Rohit runs it to point
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs good length ball outside off, Rohit opens the face of the bat and steers it behind point
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run comes forward to a fuller delivery outside off and blocks.

Lyon to Kohli, no run flighted outside off, Kohli attempts to turn the ball past short leg but he is unable to get to the pitch of the ball. A bit of turn makes it go off the inside edge to short fine leg
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run tossed up outside off, Kohli rolls his wrists on the ball to pick up a single to mid-on

Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run huuuuge appeal as Rohit hides his bat behind pad. But umpire Gould shakes his head. Had a big stride and perhaps the turn might have taken it down leg. And there was a puff of dust as well. Oh, HawkEye says it would bounce over the top of middle
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run tossed up outside off and Rohit lunges forward to block again. This time he gets an inside edge
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs jumps down the track, turns a flighted ball into a full toss and lifts it over the top of the bowler. Wonderfully batting
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run well played, lined up the flighted ball outside off and realised he has enough room to sweep and keep it along the ground to deep square leg
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length on off stump, Rohit nudges to short midwicket
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish and outside off, Rohit drives with a straight bat into the off side
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, 1 run goes short on off stump, but Rohit has enough time to pull and keep it down to deep square leg
Siddle to Kohli, no run shortish and outside off, Kohli blocks down the pitch
Siddle to Kohli, no run fuller delivery outside off, Kohli drives at the bowler
Siddle to Kohli, no run back of a length and outside off, Kohli gets across to block it

Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run comes down the track, and yet he can't reach the pitch. Lyon, as he has been doing all day, gets some turn and bounce and hits the bat rather high and veered away past the right of the cut strip

Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run looped up outside off and he lunges forward to pad up and weathers a particularly strong appeal. There was some sharp turn and Rohit was pushing forward as far as he could as well. Might have been high and HawkEye says it would have been clipping. Very close call for Rohit
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run length ball outside off, Rohit gets down on one knee and sweeps powerfully to deep square leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run goes back to a flatter ball on off stump and clips to square leg
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run pushed down the ground to long-on
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run was there an inside edge? Rohit looks for the sweep again, but this one kicks a bit more and loops over the keeper. Slips tries to reach it, but fails
Johnson to Kohli, no run good length ball outside off, gets forward and leaves
Johnson to Kohli, no run good length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
Johnson to Kohli, no run pushed across Kohli at 139 kph, Kohli shoulders arms again
Johnson to Kohli, no run full and wide, Kohli reaches out and drives to cover
Johnson to Kohli, 1 run banged in short, but Kohli swivels on the back foot and pulls quite well to deep square leg
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, 1 run attempts a bouncer and Rohit hops back and pulls to deep square leg. It was uppish, but there was no one in the vicinity to take advantage
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run flatter delivery on middle and leg, Rohit sweeps a little dangerously and is lucky for it to fall short of short fine leg
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run flighted outside off and Rohit works it down to mid-on
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run stays a touch low this time, but with the ball turning a bit too far down leg, Kohli is able to clip it behind square leg
Lyon to Kohli, no run flatter delivery on off stump, defended
Lyon to Kohli, no run good length ball just outside off, defended
Lyon to Kohli, 1 run flighted on off stump, Kohli drives to long-on and wants two. Not there.

Johnson to Kohli, OUT down the throat of deep fine leg and Johnson has picked the big wicket! It's the bouncer again, it's on middle, it came at the batsman too early and the top edge swirls to Ryan Harris who rushes in and dives forward to take it. The front-foot check looks scary, but Johnson has a couple of millimeters behind the l

Johnson to Saha, no run welcomes him with a bouncer that hits Saha on the gloves even as he was trying to sway away from the line. Johnson looks to be back. Did not give the batsman anything to work with and Saha did well to pull the bottom hand off and ensure it falls by his feet
Johnson to Saha, no run another shortish ball on and around off stump and Saha has sunk to his knees and sways away quite extravagantly
Johnson to Saha, no run another short ball on middle and off, drops his wrists and lets it go through to the keeper
Johnson to Saha, no run back of a length on middle, Saha is firmly on the back foot and nudges it away
Johnson to Saha, no run right up there on off stump, Saha is careful as he drives to mid-off
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run stands up tall and punches a shortish delivery from outside off down to mid-on
Lyon to Saha, no run flighted outside off, Saha lunges forward to block
Lyon to Saha, no run tossed up outside off and smothers the spin
Lyon to Saha, no run goes back as he sees the length shorter and taps it to leg gully
Lyon to Saha, no run presses forward to block outside off and the turn takes the inside edge down the pitch

Lyon to Saha, 1 run four men around the bat, and one of them was in business. Saha was itching to get off the mark as he leans forward and clips the flighted ball past short leg. It went uppishly as well
Johnson to Saha, no run yorker outside off, Saha digs it out
Johnson to Saha, no run 141kph, good length ball on the stumps, Saha defends gingerly

Johnson to Saha, no run sees the short ball early and Saha arches himself back and away from the line of the ball. Love that he always keeps his eyes on the ball and doesn't turn his back on the bouncer
Johnson to Saha, no run back of a length and outside off, let through to the keeper
Johnson to Saha, no run banged in short and at the body - quite an acute angle, actually -, Saha veers away and realises he also has to pull his bottom hand off the bat. Brilliant leave
Johnson to Saha, no run back over the wicket, Saha pushes it to cover and the umpires call time
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run perfect line with just enough cut back in at Rohit and he is in a spot of bother while trying to tuck the ball to midwicket
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run some inswing on offer for Harris, as there was last evening as well. Rohit leans forward and drives with an open face into the covers
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run jams a yorker on off stump, and it's threat is enhanced with some inward movement as well. Rohit plays late and digs it out
Harris to Rohit Sharma, 2 runs that tail in began off a straighter line this time and Rohit is able to clip it behind square leg. Well played

Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run holds its line this time! Lovely set up from Ryano, and he'd have been pleased with Rohit poking with an open face without moving his front foot across. Only thing missing for the bowler was the outside edge
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run the sound that excites the Aussies was bat hitting pad as Ryano straightens a fuller delivery on fifth stump and beats Rohit again. Haddin didn't appeal though
Johnson to Saha, no run fuller delivery armed with the left-armer's angle across, Saha does not bother with it
Johnson to Saha, no run full on off stump, Saha blocks it into the covers. But gee, that bat takes a beating when the Johnson-powered ball strikes it
Johnson to Saha, no run 140kph, just back of a length on middle, Saha is solidly behind it

Johnson to Saha, 3 runs hint of movement away and it lures Saha's outside edge off a drive that was intended into the covers. Beats Warner in the gully and they snare three before second slip catches up with it
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, no run bouncer, but it was directed down leg stump and Rohit has an easy leave
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, no run teasing line outside off but Rohit won't be tempted
Harris to Saha, no run gets a strong front foot stride and plays a cover drive off a fuller ball outside off
Harris to Saha, no run good length ball seeking the nick off to slip, Saha won't oblige
Harris to Saha, 1 run fullish with a hint of tail in and Saha lunges forward and times a drive between cover and mid-off for a single
Harris to Rohit Sharma, 1 run punched to mid-off and Rohit makes it across to the other end. Australia are exploring a lovely, fuller length again
Harris to Saha, no run back of a length and outside off, Saha's judgment is top class. Covers his stumps and leaves it outside his eyeline
Harris to Saha, no run fuller delivery outside off brings Saha forward to block
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, no run strays into the overpitched area with his length and Rohit drives to cover
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball outside off, Rohit will not bother with it

Johnson to Rohit Sharma, no run loooose! Johnson teases out the poke from Rohit outside his off stump, but cannot get the outside edge. Are they feeding India's batsmen with drivable balls so that they'd err when the good length comes down?
Johnson to Rohit Sharma, 1 run shortish on off stump, Rohit stands up tall to drop the ball into the off side with soft hands and races off to the other end
Johnson to Saha, no run back of a length and only a shade outside off, Saha trusts the angle from the left-armer and the bounce on this pitch and leaves
Johnson to Saha, no run another short ball pushed across Saha, doesn't lure him into playing this time either
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball outside off brings Rohit across to block, the sound of bat hitting pad tempts an appeal. Should be tighter there
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fullish on off stump and that's when Rohit should come forward and push down the ground, as he does
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run good length ball at 143kph outside off, Rohit leaves wisely
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run full on middle, Rohit nudges to short midwicket
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length on fourth stump, Rohit defends
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run brings down the angled face on a fuller ball seeking off stump and drives to cover
Johnson to Saha, no run pushes Saha back with a 142 kph short ball on off stump that gets a lot of clapping from Clarke and the Australia fielders. Defended
Johnson to Saha, no run stays beside the shortish ball and punches it into the covers
Johnson to Saha, no run seeks the yorker on off stump, at 139 kph, Saha bunts it down to mid-off
Johnson to Saha, no run fullish and skidding onto off stump, Saha presents a full face to it
Johnson to Saha, no run 141kph fullish on off stump, Saha defends quite solidly
Johnson to Saha, no run makes him jump off his toes to negotiate this shortish delivery on off stump at 141 kph. The accuracy this morning has been something special
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run ducks back in off the pitch and Rohit manages an inside edge onto his thigh. Ryno creating some nerves
Harris to Rohit Sharma, no run fuller delivery outside off, Rohit drives to mid-off

Harris to Rohit Sharma, 1 run banged in short and Rohit has to drag it from outside off with his hook, off the front foot as well. Not in control of the stroke and it was played purely on instinct. Top bowling
Harris to Saha, no run full on off stump, defended stoutly off the front foot
Harris to Saha, no run another bouncer outside off, Saha sways away
Harris to Saha, 1 run back of a length and tucking him up on middle and leg, Saha is a little worried by the bounce as he tucks it away behind square leg

Johnson to Saha, FOUR runs juicy full toss outside off, Saha throws his bat at it and picks up the first boundary of the morning through extra cover. Almost seemed surprised by the run-scoring opportunity, but managed to capitalise
Johnson to Saha, no run full and outside off, Saha taps it to mid-off
Johnson to Saha, FOUR runs beautiful stroke from Saha. He's looked sharp on the front foot this morning and this was overpitched outside off. Driven sweetly through cover
Johnson to Saha, no run back of a length and outside off, left for Haddin
Johnson to Saha, no run back of a length on leg, Saha tucks it to mid-on
Johnson to Saha, no run teases him outside off with the fuller length, Saha is wary of the threat and lets it go to the keeper
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, 1 run swept first ball to deep square leg. Picked it off a length, he should be careful in case there is some extra bounce
Lyon to Saha, no run a touch short and way outside off, but the rip in makes the ball threaten middle stump and Saha punches to cover
Lyon to Saha, no run tossed up on a length, Saha goes back and works it to short fine leg
Lyon to Saha, 2 runs a bit more bounce than Saha expected as he rocked back to try and cut from the stumps, but he adjusts, softens his hands and runs it down to third man
Lyon to Saha, no run looped up outside off, defended capably
Lyon to Saha, 1 run a touch short but he is spinning the ball enough to make Saha wait and then play with a straighter bat into the covers
Siddle to Saha, no run fuller delivery on off stump, defended to short midwicket

Siddle to Saha, no run opts for a short ball and Saha's spotted it early. Sinks to his knees, drops his wrists and he needed to do so because the ball doesn't bounce too much. Beautiful technique again
Siddle to Saha, no run back of a length on off stump, Saha defends and almost had to adjust. He's been playing balls at over 140kph, and this was 132 kph

Siddle to Saha, 3 runs gorgeous! It was a touch too full and the curl on only helps Saha as he taps the ball down the ground and times it away for three runs. Making a case for his own Game Plan video
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run back of a length and outside off, Rohit prefers to block off the front foot
Siddle to Rohit Sharma, no run cuts back in quite sharply off a good length and Rohit defends. Just about
Lyon to Saha, no run goes back to a good length ball and turns it away past short leg's left
Lyon to Saha, 1 run a bit short and his footwork is quick enough to push him back, get beside the ball and punch through point
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, no run tossed up outside off to bring Rohit forward and block. Lovely line and length from Lyon
Lyon to Rohit Sharma, FOUR runs jumps down the track and lofts Lyon over mid-on. Sparkling footwork from Rohit as he reaches the pitch and then swings his hands through the line. Very good stroke

Lyon to Rohit Sharma, OUT he's caught it! What a soft dismissal! It was a loopy delivery outside off and Rohit has come down the track to try and nudge it away. But all he's managed is return the ball back into the bowler's hands. Lyon had to dive to his right off his followthrough and just about holds on. Australia badly wanted that
Lyon to Karn, no run tossed up on off stump, defended
Siddle to Saha, no run good length ball outside off, Saha shoulders arms
Siddle to Saha, no run fuller delivery on middle and leg, turned away to short midwicket
Siddle to Saha, 2 runs shortish and outside off, Saha decides to reach out for it and guide the ball away behind point and India go past 400
Siddle to Saha, no run back of a length and outside off, Saha defends
Siddle to Saha, no run fuller delivery cutting back on off stump, defended
Lyon to Karn, 3 runs looped up on leg stump and Karn has nudged it past mid-on's right to pick up three runs to get off the mark in Test cricket
Lyon to Saha, 1 run jumps back to a shortish ball and slices it behind point. There was another run on offer, but Karn wasn't ready for it
Lyon to Karn, no run huge appeal from the bowler as he sees the ball leaps past the outside edge. Haddin did not go up, so that was a giveaway. Bat hitting pad was the noise
Lyon to Karn, no run flighted outside off and Karn goes for a whippy drive through the covers and is beaten again. Beautiful bowling from Lyon, looping it up, luring the drive and deceiving him
Lyon to Karn, no run beaten outside off again
Lyon to Karn, 1 run closer to off, he gets bat on it, a thick outside edge, wide of cover for a single

Siddle to Karn, no run he's shouldered arms to a straight ball! Siddle launches into an appeal and it looked very very close as well. Perhaps the ball might have just snaked down the off stump. And it pitched outside leg Hit the top flap of the pad and Erasmus is right

Siddle to Shami, FOUR runs cracked behind point as he stays beside the line of a shortish delivery and his hands are quick enough to produce a rather eye-catching boundary. Makes Siddle smile broadly.
Siddle to Shami, 3 runs fullish on middle and Shami just about manages to get an outside edge. He prefers to stay leg side of the ball again
Siddle to Saha, no run full and outside off, Saha drills it to cover and it would have gone skipping to the boundary had it not been for Mitchell Marsh
Siddle to Saha, no run defended into the off side
Lyon to Shami, no run tossed up outside off and Shami reaches out to block. Tailender against the turning ball

Lyon to Shami, 2 runs runs down the track and swings all across the line against a length ball. Would have been stumped by miles had the inside edge not connected, and it wasn't too far away from the short midwicket fielder either
Lyon to Shami, no run flighted outside off, lunges forward and blocks
Lyon to Shami, no run looped up outside off, nudged into the covers

Lyon to Shami, FOUR runs dropped and six, is it? It was a huuuuge mis-hit. Shami has decided he cannot survive just defending and has launched the ball into the deep midwicket region. Siddle is the man there, backtracking with the reverse cup but it bursts through, goes off the brim of the cap and into the boundary on the bounce
Lyon to Shami, no run flighted outside off, defended
Siddle to Saha, no run fullish on off stump, pushed back at mid-off. Solid straight face
Siddle to Saha, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to cover. He's looked very good today, Saha
Siddle to Saha, 1 run clipped behind square leg and Saha gets across to the other end. Shami has three to survive
Siddle to Shami, no run good length ball angled in on leg stump, Shami is not very keen to get in line with it and blocks with the open face
Siddle to Shami, 2 runs short ball on middle, Shami has got down on one knee and tries to duck and leaves the periscope. And it rebounds off it past short leg
Siddle to Shami, no run fuller ball on middle, gets in line and blocks into the off side
Lyon to Saha, no run good length ball on off stump, nudges to short leg
Lyon to Saha, no run waits on the length ball and works it from off stump to short fine leg

Lyon to Saha, OUT he's gone! Lyon keeps troubling everyone. But did it hit the bat? It was a gorgeous offspinner that brought the right-hander forward to block. The turn beats his inside edge, hits the pad and umpire Gould must think it kissed the glove on the way to first slip. I didn't see anything though...
Lyon to Sharma, no run tossed up outside off, defended
Lyon to Aaron, no run flighted outside off, Aaron looks to drive towards mid-off and is kept quiet by the turn

Siddle to Shami, 2 runs fuller delivery on off stump, Shami goes for a loft over mid-on and barely times it. The ball balloons off the closed face and Clarke makes a terrific one-handed attempt. Runs, dives to his left but it just about evades him
Siddle to Shami, no run searing yorker on leg stump, keeps it out quite well.
Siddle to Shami, no run length ball outside off, clears front leg like Steven Smith but he can't connect with the ball like Steven Smith
Siddle to Shami, no run back of a length on leg stump, Shami jumps across to flick the ball and only inside edges onto pad
Siddle to Shami, 3 runs over the keeper! It was the short ball and Shami has loaded up for the pull a little late though. Manages to place it at no-man's land around fine leg
Siddle to Aaron, no run fuller ball on off stump, Aaron steps forward and defends quite solidly

Lyon to Shami, FOUR runs runs down at Lyon and Shami has managed to nail this! He didn't quite get to the pitch, but I don't think that's a priority for Shami right now. He had enough room and so he capitalised
Lyon to Shami, 1 run runs at him again and swings off his hips. Runs down to deep midwicket
Lyon to Aaron, 1 run nips down the track and lifts the ball over Lyon's head
Lyon to Shami, 2 runs down the track again and he lofts Lyon inside out over the covers
Lyon to Shami, 1 run shortish and turning down leg as Shami belts it to deep square leg
Lyon to Aaron, 2 runs whacked down the ground after the tailender jumps down the ground. Mid-off manages to catch up with it and that's three runs
Siddle to Shami, no run fuller delivery on leg stump, Shami allows a clean line of sight at the stumps and denies Siddle with a straight bat

Siddle to Shami, SIX runs short delivery on off stump and Shami has slammed it miles over midwicket. He's no longer afraid of Siddle's pace, not when it sits up like that. Mitchell Marsh was on the boundary. But it lobbed him
Siddle to Shami, no run full and outside off, Shami loads up for another slog without any footwork and misses extravagantly

11.35 am Australia have earned a 73-run lead after an hour and a half's worth of good work this morning. Nathan Lyon was going to be key with the Adelaide pitch roughing up. He's claimed three of the five wickets that fell today and has looked immensely impressive. India's bowlers will need to show they've settled down from the first-innings
Innings Start

Shri: "As India gets to 100, can't help but think that throughout this game, India has lost one more wicket than they should have (100/1 at lunch was good, 100/2 is Australia's session). I think this is going to prove one wicket too many in the end."
